intro: Bunchosia lindeniana var. boliviensis, commonly known as the Bolivian bunchosia, is a shrub native to South America, particularly Bolivia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. It typically grows in dry, open habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance in its native range.
